definition-item.definition-title: MERRY-GO-ROUNDS; SWINGS; ROCKING-HORSES; CHUTES; SWITCHBACKS; SIMILAR DEVICES FOR PUBLIC AMUSEMENT

section-body.paragraph-text: Roundabouts, up-and-down hill tracks, swings, see-saws, rocking-horses, toy animals for riding, chutes, rotating or rocking pots, bumper cars, Russian swings, Ferris wheels, rolling drums and amusement arrangements in general, e.g. playground appliances.

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements or fittings on vehicles for protecting or preventing injuries to occupants or pedestrians in case of accidents or other traffic risks
Arrangements or fittings on amusement vehicles for protecting or preventing injuries to occupants or pedestrians in case of accidents

definition-item.definition-title: rotated by pushing the feet against a fixed surface or by running
with seats performing movements in a horizontal plane, other than circular movements
with turntables moved up and down
with turntables and movably-mounted vehicles thereon which move to the outside when the roundabout is rotated

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for generating current of water in swimming pools
Swimming or splash baths or pools
Devices for producing waves in swimming pools

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Training appliances or apparatus for surfing, i.e. without a sail; for skate or snow boarding
Design or layout of playing courts, rinks, bowling greens or areas for water-skiing; Covers therefor

definition-item.definition-title: Accessories for roundabouts not restricted to one of groups A63G1/00 or A63G3/00

table-column.paragraph-text: Chain couplings, Shackles; Chain joints; Chain links; Chain bushes

definition-item.definition-title: Driving mechanisms, such as ropes, gear, belt, motor drive

abbreviations.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following abbreviations are often used:

table-column.paragraph-text: See-saw
Teeter-totter

definition-item.definition-title: Cradle swings; Rocking-horses; Like devices resting on the ground

table-column.paragraph-text: Small beds for newborns or infants, e.g. bassinets or cradles

section-body.paragraph-text: Mounted on links contemplates, for instance, elastic links and other types of mechanical links that allow rocking motions.

definition-item.definition-title: with dismountable runners usable for other purposes

section-body.paragraph-text: Rocking-horses with any type of dismountable runners directed to add further functionalities and usability to the rocking-horses

definition-item.definition-title: Rocking horses on runners adapted for progressive movement

Children's cycles

definition-item.definition-title: Swingably-mounted toy animals for riding made to travel by means of parallelogram-joints
made to travel by ratchet-wheels, e.g. by stretching the legs
by pressing the seats or saddles up-and-down
by moving the stirrups or pedals

table-column.paragraph-text: Rider propulsion of wheeled vehicles

section-body.paragraph-text: Toy animals for riding propelled by foot power

table-column.paragraph-text: Training appliances for simulating the movement of horses

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Helter-skelters
A funfair amusement park ride with a slide built in a spiral around a high tower. Users climb up inside the tower and slide down the outside, usually on a mat or sack.

section-body.paragraph-text: Chutes with driven slideways, i.e. slideways or part of the slideways that are suitable to be moved from one position to another one.

definition-item.definition-title: with forced removal of the passenger from the seat

section-body.paragraph-text: Jolting substructures, e.g. providing for rough motion, sudden abrupt movement.

definition-item.definition-title: with undulatory motion of the substructure
with looping, hopping, or throwing motions of the substructure
with inflatable and movable substructures (connection of valves to inflatable elastic bodies B60C29/00)

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for jumping
Mats or the like for absorbing shocks for jumping, gymnastics or the like
